objects.description: Audit config for the AS_ADT_SAMPLE_Parent CDT

objects.name: AS_ADT_UT_buildSimpleFieldChanges
objects.description: Given a list of simple fields from an auditing configuration, an old object, and a new object, returns  list of simple field dictionaries which can be cast to the simple field auditing type of any complex auditing object.

objects.name: AS_ADT_UT_buildSimpleFieldChangesDictionary
objects.description: Given the fieldName, original object, and the new object, determines if a simple field change was made, returning {} if not, and returning a dictionary representation of the simple field audit if so.

objects.name: AS_ADT_UT_calculateAudit
objects.description: Primary rule to calculate audits between old and new objects (handles arrays or single objects)

objects.name: AS_ADT_UT_calculateAudit_MultipleObjects
objects.description: [DO NOT CALL DIRECTLY] Calculates audit CDTs for an array of original and new objects

objects.name: AS_ADT_UT_calculateAudit_SingleObject
objects.description: [DO NOT CALL DIRECTLY] Calculates audit CDTs for a single of original and new object

objects.name: AS_ADT_UT_determineAuditActionCode
objects.description: Given a newObject, an oldObject, and the auditConfig, determines the auditActionCode

objects.name: AS_ADT_UT_startAuditProcess_Parameters
objects.description: Populated the parameters for starting the audit process

objects.name: AS_CO_CONS_PRIMITIVE_TYPE_ARRAY
objects.description: Array of type numbers of primitive types (1 text, 2 int, 3 dec, 4 boolean, 5 date, 6 datetime, 7 time, 8 user, 9 group, 10 user or group, 11 document, 12 folder)

objects.name: AS_CO_UT_booleanDefaultFalse
objects.description: Default a null value to false, otherwise returns the boolean value

objects.name: AS_CO_UT_cast
objects.description: Casts a variable to the type of either the input `type`, or the typeof of the input `typeof`, and properly handles for null inputs

objects.name: AS_CO_UT_castToDictionary
objects.description: Casts the input to dictionary, either a list or a non-list depending on the input

objects.name: AS_CO_UT_castToDictionaryList
objects.description: Casts the input to a dictionary list

objects.name: AS_CO_UT_compare
objects.description: Compares two values and returns true if both the content of the values match (regardless of type).

objects.name: AS_CO_UT_compareStrong
objects.description: Compares two values and returns true if both the values and their types match.

objects.name: AS_CO_UT_displayValue
objects.description: Executes displayValue, but allows setting the default to either the first or last value of the replacement list, or a custom value

objects.name: AS_CO_UT_displayValueMultiple
objects.description: For each item in the values list, executes displayValue.  Allows setting the default to either the first or last value of the replacement list, or a custom value.

objects.name: AS_CO_UT_distinct
objects.description: Returns the distinct values from a list.

objects.name: AS_CO_UT_dynamicDictionary
objects.description: Creates a dictionary based on the provided field-value pairs. An example implementation is provided as a test case. Returns a dictionary.

objects.name: AS_CO_UT_filterCdtByField
objects.description: Filters a CDT by a matching a single value or list of values in a single field, if a list is passed, all matches are returned

objects.name: AS_CO_UT_getTypeNamespace
objects.description: Returns the namespace from the type! input

objects.name: AS_CO_UT_indexPath
objects.description: Pass in a field (i.e. member[1].name) and this will index(index(index( for each field

objects.name: AS_CO_UT_initializeBlankLocalVariable
objects.description: Use this to initialize a null or empty local variable of a specific type. Pass `type` to initialize as a specific type, or `typeOf` to initialize as the type of another variable.

objects.name: AS_CO_UT_isBlank
objects.description: Evaluates if the provided value is empty/blank. Returns True or False.

objects.name: AS_CO_UT_isNotBlank
objects.description: A not() wrapped around AS_CO_UT_isBlank

objects.name: AS_CO_UT_not
objects.description: Null handles for not -- null returns true (null acts like false)

objects.name: AS_CO_UT_queryEntity
objects.description: Helper rule to execute queries with minimal overhead, pass `returnType` based on the query purpose

objects.name: AS_CO_UT_queryRecord
objects.description: Helper rule to execute record queries with minimal overhead, pass `returnType` based on the query purpose

objects.name: AS_CO_UT_rejectCdtByField
objects.description: Removes CDT indices where a match of a single value or list of values in a single field is found, if a list is passed, all matches are rejected

objects.name: AS_CO_UT_rejectNullValuesFromArray
objects.description: Removes null values from an array of primitive types or CDTs (for CDT the index must be null, not each field)

objects.name: AS_CO_UT_replaceNull
objects.description: Returns nullableValue only if it is not null. Else returns replacementValue.

objects.name: AS_CO_UT_returnArrayTypeNumber
objects.description: Returns the array type number from the input type. If type number being passed is already that of a array, returns the same number.

objects.name: AS_CO_UT_returnCdtFields
objects.description: Returns an array of a CDTs fields. Note that this only works on Appian CDTs, not Dictionary or List of Variant

objects.name: AS_CO_UT_returnCdtIndicesByField
objects.description: Returns the indices of a CDT by a matching a single value or list of values in a single field, if a list is passed, all matches are returned

objects.name: AS_CO_UT_returnNullDictionary
objects.description: Returns a null dictionary

objects.name: AS_CO_UT_returnSingleTypeObject
objects.description: Takes in either an array type or a primitive type and returns the singular type object, works for CDTs or primitive types

objects.name: AS_CO_UT_returnTypeNumber
objects.description: Returns the typeNumber of either `type` or `typeOf`

objects.name: AS_CO_UT_toString
objects.description: casts a value to a string with correct handling for integer and decimal formatting

objects.name: AS_CO_UT_typeCompare
objects.description: Returns true if the two input types match

objects.name: AS_CO_UT_updateCdtFields
objects.description: Updates one or more fields of a CDT, with an optional input for indices

objects.name: AS_CO_UT_updateCdtFieldsByFieldValuePairs
objects.description: Allows passing field-value pairs to handle for use cases where you have to set newValues as arrays

objects.name: AS_CO_UT_whereContains
objects.description: Enhanced wherecontains() which avoids type-casting issues and properly handles for document and group types

objects.name: AS_CO_UT_zINTERNAL_returnCdtFields_handler
objects.description: Used by rule `AS_CO_UT_returnCdtFields`

objects.description: Used by rule `AS_CO_UT_returnCdtFields`

objects.name: AS_GAM_convertEpochSecondtoDateTime
objects.description:
Converts the Epoch seconds value to Date time value.

The Unix epoch (or Unix time or POSIX time or Unix timestamp) is the number of seconds that have elapsed since January 1, 1970 (midnight UTC/GMT), not counting leap seconds (in ISO 8601: 1970-01-01T00:00:00Z). The epoch is Unix time 0 (midnight 1/1/1970), but 'epoch' is often used as a synonym for Unix time.
called_by: AS GCM FAR Write Clauses Data
